ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Unique identifier for Site or Clinic
Notes: -2= Not collected at this time point; -3= Historical missing

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Taking lots of medications
Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Remembering how and when to take medication
Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Paying for prescriptions, over the counter medication or equipment
Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Collecting prescription medication
Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Monitoring your medical conditions (e.g. checking your blood pressure or blood sugar, monitoring your symptoms etc.)
Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Arranging appointments with health professionals

ElementDescription: How much difficulty do you have with the following? Seeing lots of different health professionals

Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected

Notes: 0= Not difficult; 1= A little difficult; 2= Quite difficult; 3= Very difficult; 4= Extremely difficult; 7777= Does not apply; 8888= Item/instrument not collected
